data.title: Heidi Klum & Ex-Husband Seal Share Rare Glimpse Into Life With Their Kids
data.meta_description: Heidi Klum and Seal both recently shared rare updates about life with their kids.
data.text:
Heidi Klum and ex-husband Seal are very private when it comes to the lives of their kids. Sure, Leni Klum, 19, is a model, but their other children â€” Henry, 17, Johan, 16, and Lou, 13 â€” are still underage, and their parents tend to keep them off social media. But this week, the former Victoriaâ€™s Secret Angel and British singer both shared glimpses of their kids, and itâ€™s so sweet to see.

Over the weekend, Klum brought Lou and one of her sons to see BeyoncÃ©â€™s Renaissance Tour. â€œ@beyonce ğŸ¥³â¤ï¸ğŸ‰ğŸ’ƒğŸ¼ Happy Birthday ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³#renaissance,â€ she posted on Instagram.

Klum wears a two-piece red outfit for the concert, and she poses for the first photo in between her two kids, who are facing away from the camera. Her son is in a white t-shirt and jeans and her daughter is wearing knee-high boots with a white-and-pink jacket.

In another post from the concert, the Americaâ€™s Got Talent judge sings along to a BeyoncÃ© song in one video, then leaves the show arm-in-arm with her son in other photos. Itâ€™s such a touching moment!

Leni was absent from the concert, and a post from the â€œStand By Meâ€ singer shows why. Seal shared that he was visiting his daughter in New York. In a photo, Leni wears a white t-shirt with olive green pants as she hugs Seal, dressed in black shorts, a gray shirt, and a cream blazer.

â€œIn NY with the young woman who changed my life for the better 19yrs ago,â€ he captioned the post on Instagram. â€œThank you Leni for making me a better person ğŸ¥¹ğŸ¥¹ğŸ¥¹ Love you,-papa.â€ Aww!

Earlier this year, Seal talked about his kids joining the entertainment industry on The Kelly Clarkson Show.

â€œMy son, Henry, he sings and he has a great voice,â€ Seal told host Kelly Clarkson. â€œHe doesnâ€™t think so, but he has a really great, husky voice, you know â€¦ If thatâ€™s what he wanted to do, itâ€™s my job to just support him.â€

â€œItâ€™s a tough one,â€ he continued. â€œBecause obviously weâ€™ve traveled that road and we know how difficult it can be. But, ultimately, my advice to them is just be happy. Do whatever.â€

He added, â€œI really believe that is the point of it all. Is to try to figure out how to be as happy as possible.â€
